channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [FLINK-29495] PulsarSinkE2ECase hang
item.description:
2022-10-02T05:53:56.0611489Z "main" #1 prio=5 os_prio=0 cpu=5171.60ms elapsed=9072.82s tid=0x00007f9508028000 nid=0x54ef1 waiting on condition  [0x00007f950f994000]
2022-10-02T05:53:56.0612041Z    java.lang.Thread.State: TIMED_WAITING (parking)
2022-10-02T05:53:56.0612475Z 	at jdk.internal.misc.Unsafe.park(java.base@11.0.16.1/Native Method)
2022-10-02T05:53:56.0613302Z 	- parking to wait for  <0x0000000087d261f8> (a java.util.concurrent.locks.AbstractQueuedSynchronizer$ConditionObject)
2022-10-02T05:53:56.0613959Z 	at java.util.concurrent.locks.LockSupport.parkNanos(java.base@11.0.16.1/LockSupport.java:234)
2022-10-02T05:53:56.0614661Z 	at java.util.concurrent.locks.AbstractQueuedSynchronizer$ConditionObject.awaitNanos(java.base@11.0.16.1/AbstractQueuedSynchronizer.java:2123)
2022-10-02T05:53:56.0615428Z 	at org.apache.pulsar.common.util.collections.GrowableArrayBlockingQueue.poll(GrowableArrayBlockingQueue.java:203)
2022-10-02T05:53:56.0616165Z 	at org.apache.pulsar.client.impl.MultiTopicsConsumerImpl.internalReceive(MultiTopicsConsumerImpl.java:370)
2022-10-02T05:53:56.0616807Z 	at org.apache.pulsar.client.impl.ConsumerBase.receive(ConsumerBase.java:198)
2022-10-02T05:53:56.0617486Z 	at org.apache.flink.connector.pulsar.testutils.sink.PulsarPartitionDataReader.poll(PulsarPartitionDataReader.java:72)

https://dev.azure.com/apache-flink/apache-flink/_build/results?buildId=41526&view=logs&j=6e8542d7-de38-5a33-4aca-458d6c87066d&t=5846934b-7a4f-545b-e5b0-eb4d8bda32e1

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: cc syhily  Could you help take a look? Thx.

hxb PulsarSinkE2ECase should be failed on Java 11. Since this class has been marked with 

@Category(value = {FailsOnJava11.class})

I don't know why it would be executed on e2e_2_cron_jdk11?

The real cause is

Could not complete the operation. Number of retries has been exhausted. Failed reason: java.lang.OutOfMemoryError: Direct buffer memory

We are still waiting for Pulsar 2.11.0 for fixing this memory issue.

The Pulsar test annotation still relies on JUnit4, which is why they still get run on Java 11. I've created https://github.com/apache/flink/pull/21005 to disable them with the correct JUnit5 annotation, pending a successful review
martijnvisser Tks, but how could we know your modification works without running this on nightly build?

Downgraded from Critical to Major due to disabling the test

syhily You can run mvn verify -Prun-end-to-end-tests on the flink-end-to-end-tests-pulsar with JDK11. When doing that, you can see that after the modification the tests are skipped.
I notice this ticket is tagged to affect 1.15.2 and 1.16.0, shall we backport the fix?
Yep. We should backport to both 1.15 and 1.16.

syhily This test is now also hanging for a JDK8 run: https://dev.azure.com/apache-flink/apache-flink/_build/results?buildId=42725&view=logs&j=af184cdd-c6d8-5084-0b69-7e9c67b35f7a&t=160c9ae5-96fd-516e-1c91-deb81f59292a&l=17472

martijnvisser I have checked the CI logs. It's wired and shows a NP exception. I think we can create a new one and close this one?

martijnvisser The CI link you have provided is tests on flink release-1.15 branch. And this is an error which has been fixed in https://github.com/apache/pulsar/pull/15840 and released in Pulsar 2.10.1. Do we need to bump the pulsar-client to 2.10.1 in release-1.15 branch to fix this hang issue?
syhily If this is a release-1.15 specific issue, I suggest you open a new issue so that we don't mangle different issues into one entry.
